means: vaginal intraepithelial neoplasia 阴道上皮内瘤

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词都有"骄傲的，傲慢的"之意。
means: haughty ： 较正式用词，多用于贬义。指对身份或地位比自己低的人采取冷淡、轻视或鄙互的态度。
proud ： 含义广，普通用词。褒义指自豪和荣耀以及强烈的自尊；贬义则指傲慢，自以为是或自鸣得意。
arrogant ： 用于贬义，指过高估计自己，以致骄傲自大或傲慢无礼，目中无人。
vain ： 指一个对自己的外表或对自己留给别的印象太过分地关注，以致自命不凡，自鸣得意。

sentence.Network_en: He is still vain enough to dye his hair red.
sentence.Network_cn: 他还是很虚荣，把头发染成了红褐色。

sentence.Network_en: It became obvious that all her complaints were in vain.
sentence.Network_cn: 很明显她所有的抱怨都是白费口舌。

sentence.Network_en: I am not a vain creature.
sentence.Network_cn: 我不是个爱慕虚荣的人。

list.abs: 大学英语四级常用词组 ... in turn 依次,轮流;转而 in vain 徒劳,白费力 instead of 代替,而不是.
介词用法口诀 ... in a word 总之 in vain 无益地, 白白地 in case 如果，万一，以防.
文章- 常用英语600句 ... 258. 一言为定！ It’s a deal! 255. 白忙一场。 In vain. 256. 出师不利。 Get off on the wrong foot.

jx.jx_en_mean: use someone's name in a way that shows a lack of respect

jx.jx_cn_mean: 徒劳：毫无收益的；未成功

lj.lj_ls: 我们的劳动是白费力气

jx.jx_en_mean: In an irreverent or disrespectful manner

lj.lj_ly: took the name of the Lord in vain.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'devoid of real worth'): via Old French from Latin vanus 'empty, without substance'

entry.tran: 徒劳的;无效的;不成功的
entry.def: A vain attempt or action is one that fails to achieve what was intended.

example.ex: The drafting committee worked through the night in a vain attempt to finish on schedule...
example.tran: 起草委员会为按计划完成草案已通宵加班，但结果仍是徒劳。

example.ex: I was singing in a vain effort to cheer him up.
example.tran: 我唱歌试图让他高兴起来，结果是白费力气。

entry.def: If you describe a hope that something will happen as a vain hope, you mean that there is no chance of it happening.

example.ex: He married his fourth wife, Susan, in the vain hope that she would improve his health.
example.tran: 他娶了第四个老婆苏珊，徒然希望她能使他健康状况好转。

entry.tran: 自负的;虚荣的;自命不凡的
entry.def: If you describe someone as vain, you are critical of their extreme pride in their own beauty, intelligence, or other good qualities.

example.ex: I think he is shallow, vain and untrustworthy.
example.tran: 我认为他浅薄虚荣，不可信任。

entry.def: If you do something in vain, you do not succeed in achieving what you intend.

example.ex: He stopped at the door, waiting in vain for her to acknowledge his presence...
example.tran: 他在门口停住，徒然地等待她和自己打招呼。

example.ex: It became obvious that all her complaints were in vain.
example.tran: 很明显她所有的抱怨都是白费口舌。

entry.tran: 无用的;无意义的;无价值的
entry.def: If you say that something such as someone's  death, suffering, or effort was in vain, you mean that it was useless because it did not achieve anything.

example.ex: He wants the world to know his son did not die in vain.
example.tran: 他想让全世界都知道，他的儿子不是白白死去的。

means.word_mean: 1. characteristic of false pride; having an exaggerated sense of self-importance;

sentences.sentence: "so swollen by victory that he was unfit for normal duty"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 高级的, 年老的, 先进的
stems_affixes.word_buile: advance[n.&v.前进, 提升]+ed表形容词→adj.高级的, 年老的, 先进的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 渐消失的, 易消散的, 会凋零的
stems_affixes.word_buile: e出+van空+escent开始……的→开始空出去的→渐消失的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 徒然的, 无益的, 虚荣的, 空虚的
stems_affixes.word_buile: vain=van空→adj.徒然的, 无益的, 虚荣的, 空虚的
van空+ity表名词→心里空空→虚荣心

stems_affixes.value_cn: 逐渐消失, 容易消失, 幻灭, 瞬息
stems_affixes.word_buile: e出+van空+escency开始→开始空出去→渐消失
ad向+van前卫,先锋+ce→n.&v.前进, 提升

Sentence.sentence: A lot of effort is made in vain.

means.word_mean: 自负的; 爱慕虚荣的

sentences.en: She is one of those vain people who never take others' advice.
sentences.cn: 她属于那种自负得从不听别人劝告的人。

sentences.en: I don't like a vain woman.
sentences.cn: 我讨厌爱慕虚荣的女人。

sentences.en: He's very vain of his abilities.
sentences.cn: 他对于自己的能力很自负。

means.word_mean: 徒劳的, 无用的, 无效的

sentences.en: He made a vain attempt to reach the drowning child.
sentences.cn: 他试图接近那个快淹死的小孩, 但没有成功。
我的一切努力都白费了。
